subject: Re: [junit] DataBase Testing
msgSnippet: Why not just make the columns not nullable? i.e. Create Table FlightInfo ( FlightNo number PRIMARY KEY, AirlineName varchar(50) not null, Source varchar(50)
messageBody:
Why not just make the columns not nullable?

i.e.

Create Table FlightInfo
(
FlightNo number PRIMARY KEY,
AirlineName varchar(50) not null,
Source varchar(50) not null,
Destination varchar(50) not null,
TotalSeats number not null,
AvailableSeats number not null,
Cost number not null
)

>>> wvuvivek@... 11/14/02 07:09am >>>
Hi Junitians,
Thx for all the time and help in all my previous
queries.This is question i have for a database unit
testing.
I have created a table called FlightInfo and stored
data into it. What i need is to write a testcase to
check for a null condition.ie if a null value is
inserted into the database, it should "spit" out that
error!!
I am sending a fragment of code i have written.
Thanks again for your time and help.
Vivek


public static void StoreData()
{
try
{
st.executeUpdate("Insert into FlightInfo values
(434,'Boeing707','JFK','PIT',200,30,300)");
st.executeUpdate("Insert into FlightInfo values
(13,'Boeing','DULL','LAX',30,30,400)");
st.executeUpdate("Insert into FlightInfo values
(113,'Boeing','JFK','LAX',null,10,100)");
conn.close();
}
catch(Exception t)
{
t.printStackTrace();
}
}
public static void CreateTables()
{
try
{
String createfi="Create Table FlightInfo (FlightNo
number PRIMARY KEY, AirlineName varchar(50),Source
varchar(50),Destination varchar(50),TotalSeats
number,AvailableSeats number,Cost number)";
st.executeUpdate(createfi);
}
catch(Exception t)
{
t.printStackTrace();
}
}
